page.title: 15MR. MACK.LOCAL DEALER.
page.content: Mr. Mack in l959 went to college to be a television engineer.He went to college in York, Harrogate and Leeds. Mr. Mack had a 5 year apprenticeship He had to learn what parts were called in t.v.s and radios. He worked for a man called Arthur Englsh. In l966 Mr. Mack decided to work for himself in Goodramgate. It was an electrical shop which sold all electric equipment. Next he opened 3 shops in Ripon, Selby, and York. He sold household furniture in York. There were 5 butchers now only 1. There were 2 grocers and 2 fish shops - now only 1 of each because they have been made into gift shops for tourists. In Feb. l984 Mr. Mack sold his shop and moved into the old telephone exchange. He called it The Warehouse . Now he just walks across the road to work. He will collect things from people.
